definition: to interrupt (sb talking)/to butt in/to cut into a conversation
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose

sentences.english: It is impolite to butt into other people's conversation.
sentences.chinese: 別人談話時插嘴是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: I never got a look-in , with everybody else talking at once.
sentences.chinese: 其他人都在講話，我一點插嘴的機會都沒有。

sentences.english: She talks so much that the rest of us never get a look-in .
sentences.chinese: 他講得滔滔不絕，別人都無法插嘴。

sentences.english: Amy loves to butt in and offer her advice even when its not wanted.
sentences.chinese: 不管時機對不對，愛米都喜歡插嘴提供意見。

sentences.english: He always cuts in while other people are talking.
sentences.chinese: 別人說話時他總愛插嘴。

sentences.english: It is impolite for children to cut in when their seniors are talking.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在他們的長輩談話時插嘴是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: This child has no manners; he always interrupts the adults when they are speaking.
sentences.chinese: 這個孩子太沒規矩了，大人說話的時候總是插嘴。

sentences.english: It is not polite to interrupt when someone is talking.
sentences.chinese: 在別人講話時插嘴是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: "You had better stay till the curtain is hung, " interposed Mrs.
sentences.chinese: “你最好等幕布掛上以後再去，”諾里斯太太插嘴說。

sentences.english: When you say invisible, " interrupted Albert, it is only to keep up the mystery".
sentences.chinese: “你說沒有看到，”阿爾貝插嘴說，別故作神祕了吧。

sentences.english: He was annoyed by what the woman bunged in.
sentences.chinese: 他對女士的插嘴感到惱火。

sentences.english: Amy loves to butt in and provide her hints and tips even when it's notwbetd.
sentences.chinese: 不論時機對不對，愛米都喜好插嘴提供意見。

sentences.english: It''s very impolite to interpose in such a formal seminar.
sentences.chinese: 在這麼正式的研討會里插嘴是很不禮貌的。

sentences.english: It’s impolite to interrupt a speaker.
sentences.chinese: 別人在說話時，插嘴是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: I wonder why he must always come barging into others' conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我真不明白他爲什麼非要在別人談話時亂插嘴不可。

sentences.english: A： Excuse me for interrupting, but you are missing the point.
sentences.chinese: 請原諒我插嘴，你跑題了。

definition: to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
interruption/to interrupt (esp. talk)/to change the subject
talkative/to speak out of turn/to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/rumors fly
socket (for an electric plug)/to interrupt (sb speaking)/to butt in
to shout at sb to stop
to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
